ask_action_plans: What is the primary management requirement concerning Energy Management Action Plans?
The organization shall establish, implement and maintain action plans for achieving its objectives and targets
What is the core purpose of establishing action plans within the EnMS?
Action plans are established for achieving its objectives and targets
What two elements related to completion must the action plans specify for individual targets?
The action plans shall include the means and time frame by which individual targets are to be achieved
What verification method must be stated in the action plan regarding performance results?
Action plans shall include a statement of the method by which an improvement in energy performance shall be verified
What verification method must be stated in the action plan regarding the documented outcome of the action?
Action plans shall include a statement of the method of verifying the results
In which phase of the EnMS model is the establishment of action plans located?
Action plans are part of the Energy Planning (Plan) phase
What output from the planning process must the organization use for the Implementation and Operation phase (4.5.1)?
The organization shall use the action plans and other outputs resulting from the planning process for implementation and operation
What key characteristic must be monitored during the Checking phase (4.6.1) regarding the action plans?
Key characteristics shall include at a minimum the effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets
What must operations and maintenance activities related to significant energy use be consistent with regarding action plans?
Operations and maintenance activities must be consistent with its energy policy, objectives, targets and action plans
What category of improvement can action plans focus on besides specific energy performance gains?
Action plans may focus on achieving improvements in overall energy management or improvement in the processes of the EnMS itself
If an action plan focuses on improving an EnMS process, what verification element must it still contain?
Action plans for these types of improvements can also state how the organization will verify the results achieved by the action plan
What specific type of improvement action can be defined in an action plan related to employee behavior?
An action plan designed to achieve increased employee and contractor awareness of energy management behaviour
What aspect of execution must the action plan specify regarding the method of work?
The action plan must specify the means by which individual targets are to be achieved
What specific record must be maintained regarding the success of action plans in the checking phase?
The results from monitoring and measurement of the key characteristics, including the effectiveness of action plans, shall be recorded
What must the EnMS documentation include regarding the achievement tools?
The EnMS documentation shall include the energy objectives, targets, and action plans
What must the organization decide upon to systematically handle updates to the action plans?
The organization must define the defined intervals at which the action plans shall be updated
What is the relationship between the Energy Targets and the Action Plans?
Action plans are established for achieving its objectives and targets
What must be defined in the action plans to ensure completion on schedule?
The time frame by which individual targets are to be achieved must be included
If an organization establishes an objective to reduce energy consumption by 5%, what part of the action plan addresses how the 5% reduction will be measured?
A statement of the method by which an improvement in energy performance shall be verified
If the management review determines a change is needed for a target, what element of the EnMS must reflect this decision?
Outputs shall include decisions or actions related to changes to objectives, targets or other elements of the EnMS, which includes action plans
Must an action plan only cover physical operations, or can it cover awareness campaigns?
Action plans can cover areas like increased employee and contractor awareness of energy management behaviour
What must be true about the results achieved by the action plan concerning employee awareness?
The extent to which the action plan achieves the increased awareness and other results should be verified using the method determined by the organization and documented in the action plan
If an organization fails to implement the action plans, which general requirement is being violated?
The requirement to implement action plans for achieving its objectives and targets
What must be defined about the verification method for the action plan's final outcome?
The action plan must include a statement of the method of verifying the results
When determining the "means" in the action plan, what type of resources might be considered?
The means may relate to resources (human, technology, financial) committed by top management
When monitoring action plans, what is the organization evaluating against the planned outcomes?
The organization is monitoring the effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets
What must the action plans include concerning the method for demonstrating actual performance gains?
A statement of the method by which an improvement in energy performance shall be verified
What section of the EnMS documentation lists the organizational tool used to achieve targets?
Clause 4.5.4.1 c) requires the documentation to include action plans
If an action plan addresses the replacement of equipment, what does the "means" section likely describe?
The means would describe the resources and methodology for the replacement
If nonconformities are detected (4.6.4), which part of the planning output is immediately affected?
The action plans, which may require necessary changes to be made to the EnMS
What element of the action plan is critical for evaluating the success rate during the management review?
The effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets
When is the management review input concerning action plans obtained?
It is obtained from the results of monitoring, measurement and analysis (4.6.1 d))
What must the organization ensure about the final output documentation of the action plan activities?
The action plan must specify the method of verifying the results
What must be true about the time frames established in the action plans?
They must specify the time frame by which individual targets are to be achieved
Who determines the verification method used for an action plan designed to increase employee awareness?
The verification method is determined by the organization and documented in the action plan
What specific organizational requirement requires consistency with the action plans?
Operational control activities related to significant energy uses must be consistent with action plans
What is the relationship between the verification method for performance improvement and the verification method for results?
Both must be stated in the action plans: one verifies improvement in energy performance and the other verifies the results (completion)
If action plans focus on achieving overall energy management improvement, what characteristic do these plans share with performance-focused plans?
They must still state how the organization will verify the results achieved by the action plan
How is the action plan linked to the EnMS's commitment to continual improvement?
Changes to action plans as an output of management review must be consistent with the organization's commitment to continual improvement
If an action plan covers multiple steps, what must be defined for each step related to timing?
The time frame by which individual targets are to be achieved
What must be measured to determine the success of the action plans in the checking phase?
The effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets
If an action plan involves procurement of new equipment, what management activity is informed by the plan?
Procurement practices (4.5.7) are informed, as operations must be consistent with action plans
What is the function of the action plans in the overall Energy Planning process diagram (Figure A.2)?
Action plans are listed as one of the key Planning Outputs
What is the relationship between the designation of responsibility in the action plan and the management representative's role?
The management representative defines and communicates responsibilities and authorities (4.2.2 f)), which includes defining those designated responsibility in action plans
What is the action required if the objectives are not met due to flawed execution of the action plan?
Corrective action is required to eliminate the cause of the nonconformity, potentially changing the action plan
If the action plan is about improving the EnMS documentation process, what type of plan is this?
An action plan focused on improvement in the processes of the EnMS itself
What organizational role uses the action plans to manage the operational activities?
The organization uses the action plans for implementation and operation (4.5.1)
Must the action plans specify the method of verification for both the improvement itself and the final results?
Yes, they must include a statement of the method by which an improvement in energy performance shall be verified and a statement of the method of verifying the results
What must be reviewed regarding the action plans during the management review?
The review input covers the effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets (via 4.6.1 d))
What is the function of the action plans in ensuring consistency between planning and execution?
The organization shall use the action plans for implementation and operation (4.5.1)
What key characteristic must be measured to assess the efficacy of the action plans?
The effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets
What must be established to ensure the necessary resources are secured for the action plans?
The energy policy includes a commitment to ensure the availability of necessary resources to achieve objectives and targets , which the action plans execute
When the organization determines the effectiveness of the corrective action taken (4.6.4), which document related to planning is often reviewed?
The action plans are often reviewed to ensure necessary changes were made to the EnMS
What must the organization define about the method of verifying the results?
The action plan must include a statement of the method
Must the organization document the method for verifying the results of an action plan?
Yes, a statement of the method of verifying the results shall be included
What must be true about the level of detail in an action plan compared to the objective?
The action plan provides the detailed means and time frame to achieve the general specified outcome (objective)
What specific output of the Energy Review must the action plans be designed to capitalize on?
The action plans execute targets which take into account opportunities to improve energy performance
How do action plans contribute to the overall PDCA framework?
Action plans are implemented in the Do phase and monitored in the Check phase
What must be true about the actions taken to address nonconformities discovered in the checking phase regarding the action plan?
Any necessary changes must be made to the EnMS, potentially altering the action plans
If the management review results in a change to resource allocation (4.7.3), how does this affect the action plans?
The change in resources must be used or implemented within the action plans (the means)
What management input provides the data for checking the effectiveness of the action plans?
The results from monitoring and measurement of the key characteristics
What are the consequences if the organization fails to designate responsibility in the action plans?
The organization fails to meet requirement 4.4.6 and potentially hinders the implementation and maintenance of the plans
What must the organization maintain regarding the execution of the action plans?
The organization must maintain records of corrective actions and preventive actions  stemming from failures in the execution of the action plans
If the action plans are deemed ineffective during an internal audit, what must the audit record contain?
The audit record must contain the audit result indicating nonconformity with the planned arrangements for energy management
What specific communication requirement is indirectly served by clear action plans?
Clear action plans aid in ensuring personnel are aware of their roles, responsibilities and authorities in achieving the requirements of the EnMS
How is the action plan linked to the concept of continual improvement (3.2)?
Action plans deliver results that will improve energy performance in accordance with the organization's energy policy, which is a continual improvement process
What must be included in the statement of the method for verifying improvement?
The method used to verify that the energy performance has improved
What must the organization ensure about the use of the action plans in day-to-day operations?
The organization must ensure operations related to SEUs are consistent with... action plans
If an action plan aims for improved energy performance, what must the verification method measure?
Measurable results related to energy efficiency, energy use and energy consumption
What must the organization record regarding the effectiveness of the action plans?
The results from monitoring and measurement of the key characteristics, including effectiveness
What is the consequence of failing to include the designation of responsibility in the action plans?
The organization fails to meet the mandatory content requirement of Clause 4.4.6
What is the ultimate purpose of the verification statements included in the action plans?
To ensure that the organization can demonstrate conformity to the requirements of its EnMS and the energy performance results achieved
What specific resource assignment must be included in the action plans?
Action plans shall include designation of responsibility
What is the mandatory documentation requirement for the action plans?
The action plans shall be documented
How often must the organization manage the accuracy and relevance of its action plans?
The action plans shall be updated at defined intervals
Who is responsible for executing the actions defined in the action plans?
The person(s) designated responsibility in the action plan
What specific part of the action plan ensures that accountability is clear?
Designation of responsibility
What must the organization do with the documented action plans at regular intervals?
The action plans shall be updated at defined intervals
In the context of operational control (4.5.5), operations must be consistent with what output of planning?
Operations must be consistent with the organization's action plans
What specific requirement ensures that the action plans are available for use?
The organization shall implement and maintain action plans
If an internal audit reviews the achievement of targets, what documented tool is the primary focus of the review?
The energy management action plans
What action is required if the organization determines that an action plan is no longer effective in achieving its targets?
The action plan shall be updated
What mandatory control applies to the action plans regarding documentation management?
They must be documented and updated at defined intervals
What organizational roles are clarified by the "designation of responsibility" in the action plans?
The person(s) responsible for executing the actions
What must be done with the action plans documentation periodically?
They shall be updated at defined intervals
What is the required state of the action plans once they are established?
They must be established, implemented and maintained
What two concepts must the action plan specify regarding how targets are met?
The means and time frame
What must be included in the statement about performance verification within the action plan?
The statement must specify the method
What must the organization ensure about the action plans regarding documentation status?
The action plans shall be documented
What must be specified in the action plan to allow for objective tracking of results?
A statement of the method of verifying the results
What specific organizational planning output drives the content and necessity of the action plans?
The objectives and targets
What is the consequence if the organization fails to update the action plans at defined intervals?
This constitutes a nonconformity with requirement 4.4.6
If an action plan specifies a target related to a significant energy use (SEU), what must be true about the daily operations linked to that SEU?
They must be consistent with... action plans
How is accountability defined within the action plan?
Through the designation of responsibility
What must the organization do to ensure the action plans remain relevant?
They must be updated at defined intervals
What organizational elements are mandated to be included in the EnMS documentation, along with objectives and targets?
The action plans
What two elements define the scope of the actions required to achieve individual targets?
The means and time frame
If an action plan is established to improve training, what element of the plan defines how the training will be improved?
The means by which the target is to be achieved
What specific energy improvement outcome is verified by one of the required statements in the action plan?
An improvement in energy performance
What must the organization ensure about the status of the action plans, related to their ongoing existence?
They must be maintained
What must the organization define for the action plans regarding periodic documentation review?
The defined intervals for updating the documented action plans
What term describes the necessary elements defined in the action plans to achieve targets?
The means
What must be monitored regarding the action plans at planned intervals?
Their effectiveness in achieving objectives and targets
What must be established to ensure the achievement of the objectives that the action plans serve?
Time frames for the achievement of objectives and targets
What does the implementation phase rely on the action plans to define?
The processes and procedures necessary to achieve the objectives
What element of the action plan is responsible for providing the required schedule?
The time frame
What must the organization ensure about the action plans' presence in the organization?
They must be implemented
What type of requirement is the statement of the method by which an improvement in energy performance shall be verified?
A mandatory content requirement for action plans
In the context of documented procedures (3.24), how are action plans categorized?
Action plans are documents required by the standard
ask_checking: What is the general requirement for the organization concerning the key characteristics of its operations?
The organization shall ensure that the key characteristics of its operations that determine energy performance are monitored, measured and analysed at planned intervals
What minimum documentation requirement applies to the results obtained from monitoring and measurement of key characteristics?
The results from monitoring and measurement of the key characteristics shall be recorded
What two organizational factors determine the appropriateness of the energy measurement plan?
The energy measurement plan must be appropriate to the size and complexity of the organization and its monitoring and measurement equipment
What type of data must the equipment used for monitoring and measurement of key characteristics provide?
The equipment must provide data which are accurate and repeatable
What specific records must be maintained to demonstrate the integrity of measurement equipment?
Records of calibration and other means of establishing accuracy and repeatability shall be maintained
What must the organization define and periodically review regarding its measurement infrastructure?
The organization shall define and periodically review its measurement needs
What mandatory response must the organization have to performance failures detected during measurement?
The organization shall investigate and respond to significant deviations in energy performance
Name one specific item that must be included as a key characteristic to be monitored, measured, and analysed.
Significant energy uses and other outputs of the energy review [60 a)]
What specific variables related to SEUs must be included as a key characteristic?
The relevant variables related to significant energy uses [60 b)]
What must be monitored to determine if objectives and targets are being met?
The effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets [60 d)]
What type of measurement data source is acceptable even for small organizations?
Measurement can range from only utility meters for small organizations [61 Note]
What must the organization determine regarding the methodology of measurement?
It is up to the organization to determine the means and methods of measurement [61 Note]
What must the equipment provide to ensure the validity of EnPI calculations?
The equipment must provide data which are accurate and repeatable
If the organization uses a software application to consolidate data, what must that application be capable of delivering?
The application must be capable of consolidating data and delivering automatic analysis [61 Note]
What must be the focus of the investigation required in response to a significant energy performance deviation?
The investigation must address the significant deviation in energy performance
How does the monitoring and measurement requirement support the 'Act' phase of the PDCA cycle?
The results from monitoring and measurement inform the actions to continually improve energy performance and the EnMS
What is the function of the energy baseline in the context of 4.6.1?
The baseline provides the reference against which changes in energy performance are measured
If monitoring shows a continuous discrepancy between actual and expected energy consumption, what mandatory action is triggered?
The organization shall investigate and respond to significant deviations in energy performance
What two characteristics of measurement equipment records must be maintained?
Records of calibration and other means of establishing accuracy and repeatability
What is the purpose of monitoring the effectiveness of the action plans?
To ensure the organization is achieving objectives and targets [60 d)]
What must be ensured about the measurement plan regarding monitoring equipment?
The plan must be appropriate to the organizationâ€™s monitoring and measurement equipment
What aspect of the energy review outputs must be monitored under 4.6.1?
Significant energy uses and other outputs of the energy review [60 a)]
What must the organization define about its needs related to data gathering?
The organization shall define and periodically review its measurement needs
What must the monitoring and measurement ensure about the EnPIs?
It ensures that the EnPIs are monitored, measured and analysed [60 c)]
What must be maintained concerning measurement equipment to ensure repeatability?
Records of other means of establishing accuracy and repeatability shall be maintained
If an organization is complex, how does this affect the energy measurement plan requirement?
The measurement plan must be appropriate to the complexity of the organization
What does the "evaluation of actual versus expected energy consumption" help determine?
It helps determine if there are significant deviations in energy performance [60 e), 62]
What must the organization ensure about the records from monitoring activities?
The results from monitoring and measurement of the key characteristics shall be recorded
If an organization fails to define its measurement needs, what is the consequence?
The organization fails to meet the requirement to define and periodically review its measurement needs
How do the key characteristics relate to the organization's overall operations?
They are the key characteristics of its operations that determine energy performance
What is the term for the process where a software application consolidates data and delivers automatic analysis?
A complete monitoring and measurement system connected to a software application [61 Note]
What must the organization ensure regarding its measurement data?
The equipment must provide data which are accurate and repeatable . 4.6.2 Evaluation of Compliance with Legal Requirements and Other Requirements
What mandatory documentation is required regarding the compliance evaluation results?
Records of the results of the evaluations of compliance shall be maintained
What specific input to the Management Review relies on the output of compliance evaluation (4.6.2)?
Results of the evaluation of compliance with legal requirements and changes in legal requirements and other requirements to which the organization subscribes [68 d)]
What aspect of legal and other requirements must be included as an input to the management review, besides compliance results?
Changes in legal requirements and other requirements to which the organization subscribes [68 d)]. 4.6.3 Internal Audit of the EnMS
What three specific outcomes must the internal audit ensure regarding the EnMS?

The audit must ensure the EnMS: 1) conforms to planned arrangements for energy management; 2) conforms with the energy objectives and targets established; and 3) is effectively implemented and maintained, and improves energy performance
What two factors must be considered when developing the audit plan and schedule?
The status and importance of the processes and areas to be audited as well as the results of previous audits
What two qualities must the audit process ensure regarding auditors and the conduct of audits?
The selection of auditors and conduct of audits shall ensure objectivity and impartiality of the audit process
What mandatory action must be taken with the audit results documentation?
Records of the audit results shall be maintained and reported to top management
In smaller organizations, how can auditor independence be demonstrated?
Auditor independence can be demonstrated by an auditor being free from responsibility for the activity being audited
What must be clearly defined if the organization chooses to combine the EnMS audit with other internal audits (e.g., quality or environment)?
The intent and scope of each should be clearly defined
What is the relationship between an energy audit (or assessment) and an internal audit of the EnMS?
An energy audit or assessment is not the same concept as an internal audit of an EnMS
What must the internal audit confirm regarding the objectives and targets?
The audit must ensure that the EnMS conforms with the energy objectives and targets established
What must be considered in the audit schedule regarding processes?
The status and importance of the processes and areas to be audited
What is the general term for the documented process used to evaluate the fulfillment of requirements?
Internal audit . 4.6.4 Nonconformities, Correction, Corrective Action and Preventive Action
What must the organization determine regarding the root of the failure?
Determining the causes of nonconformities or potential nonconformities [65 b)]
What must be evaluated to decide if further action is required after a nonconformity is found?
Evaluating the need for action to ensure that nonconformities do not occur or recur [65 c)]
What is the mandatory documentation requirement related to these actions?
Maintaining records of corrective actions and preventive actions [66 e)]
What must the organization review regarding the success of the elimination actions?
Reviewing the effectiveness of the corrective action or preventive action taken [66 f)]
What must be true about the corrective and preventive actions taken, regarding the severity of the problem?
They shall be appropriate to the magnitude of the actual or potential problems and the energy performance consequences encountered
What must the organization ensure is done to the EnMS after implementing corrective actions?
The organization shall ensure that any necessary changes are made to the EnMS
What is the difference in purpose between corrective action and preventive action?
Corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence whereas preventive action is taken to prevent occurrence [23 Note 2, 32 Note 2]
What must be included as input to the management review concerning past failures?
The status of corrective actions and preventive actions [69 g)]
If a significant deviation in energy consumption occurs (4.6.1), what management activity (4.6.4) is likely triggered?
Addressing actual and potential nonconformities by making corrections and taking corrective action . 4.6.5 Control of Records
What is the primary purpose of establishing and maintaining records?
To demonstrate conformity to the requirements of its EnMS and of this International Standard, and the energy performance results achieved
What three qualities must records possess and maintain?
Records shall be and shall remain legible, identifiable and traceable to the relevant activity
What must the organization define and implement concerning the lifecycle of records?
The organization shall define and implement controls for the identification, retrieval and retention of records
What is the definition of a record?
A record is a document stating results achieved or providing evidence of activities performed
In what context can records be used to document nonconformity management?
Records can be used to provide evidence of verification, preventive action and corrective action [33 Note 1]
What is the relationship between the records maintenance period and the energy baseline?
The energy baseline is maintained and recorded as a means for the organization to determine the records maintenance period
What are the five key characteristics that the organization must monitor, measure, and analyze at planned intervals to determine energy performance?

At a minimum, the key characteristics that must be monitored, measured, and analyzed are the significant energy uses and other outputs of the energy review, the relevant variables related to significant energy uses, the Energy Performance Indicators (EnPIs), the effectiveness of the action plans in achieving objectives and targets, and the evaluation of actual versus expected energy consumption
What must the organization ensure regarding the equipment used for monitoring and measurement?

The organization must ensure that the equipment used in the monitoring and measurement of key characteristics provides data that are accurate and repeatable . Records of calibration and other means used to establish this accuracy and repeatability must be maintained
What is required when significant deviations in energy performance are identified?
When significant deviations in energy performance are identified, the organization must investigate and respond to these deviations . The results of these investigation activities must be maintained
How often must the organization evaluate its compliance with legal and other requirements, and what documentation is necessary?

The organization shall evaluate compliance with legal requirements and other requirements to which it subscribes, related to energy use and consumption, at planned intervals . The organization must maintain records of the results of these evaluations of compliance
What are the three specific requirements an internal audit must confirm regarding the Energy Management System?

The internal audit, conducted at planned intervals, must ensure that the EnMS conforms to the planned arrangements for energy management, including the requirements of this International Standard . It must also confirm that the system conforms with the established energy objectives and targets, and that it is effectively implemented and maintained, leading to improved energy performance
What must the audit plan and schedule take into consideration when being developed?

The audit plan and schedule must be developed while taking into consideration the status and importance of the processes and areas to be audited . Additionally, the schedule must consider the results of previous audits
Who can perform internal audits, and how is impartiality demonstrated in smaller organizations?

Internal audits can be performed either by personnel from within the organization or by external persons selected by the organization to work on its behalf . In all cases, the auditors must be competent and in a position to perform the audit impartially and objectively. In smaller organizations, auditor independence can be demonstrated by the auditor being free from responsibility for the activity being audited
How should the organization manage the magnitude of corrective and preventive actions taken?

Corrective actions and preventive actions must be appropriate to the magnitude of the actual or potential problems encountered . They must also be appropriate to the resulting energy performance consequences
What are the six actions an organization must undertake when addressing actual or potential nonconformities?

When addressing nonconformities, the organization must perform six actions: reviewing nonconformities or potential nonconformities; determining their causes; evaluating the need for action to ensure the nonconformities do not occur or recur; determining and implementing the appropriate needed action; maintaining records of these actions; and finally, reviewing the effectiveness of the corrective or preventive action taken
What must the organization ensure regarding any changes resulting from corrective or preventive actions?
The organization must ensure that any necessary changes are made to the Energy Management System (EnMS) following the determination and implementation of corrective or preventive actions
What is the purpose of maintaining records regarding the Energy Management System?

The organization shall establish and maintain records as necessary to demonstrate conformity to the requirements of its EnMS and of this International Standard . Records are also necessary to demonstrate the energy performance results achieved
What controls must the organization implement regarding records?

The organization must define and implement controls for the identification, retrieval, and retention of records . Furthermore, records must be and shall remain legible, identifiable, and traceable to the relevant activity
Name the planning document that must be defined and implemented to govern measurement activities.
An energy measurement plan shall be defined and implemented
What must be maintained concerning the investigation and response activities related to significant deviations?
Results of these activities shall be maintained
What specific performance metrics (quantitative values) must be monitored as key characteristics?
EnPIs (Energy Performance Indicators) [60 c)]
What specific comparison must be performed as a key characteristic of operations?
Evaluation of actual versus expected energy consumption [60 e)]
How is the required frequency of monitoring and measurement defined?
It must occur at planned intervals
What is the required state of the results derived from investigating significant deviations?
Results of these activities shall be maintained
What type of analysis must be performed on the key characteristics?
The key characteristics must be analysed at planned intervals
What must be true about the frequency of reviewing measurement needs?
Measurement needs shall be periodically reviewed
What phase of the EnMS model is represented by Clause 4.6?
The Check phase
What must be true about the monitoring, measurement, and analysis activities concerning their schedule?
They must be conducted at planned intervals
What specific energy performance component (besides SEUs and EnPIs) must be monitored?
Other outputs of the energy review [60 a)]
In what context are the results of monitoring and measurement used as input?
They are used as input to the management review
What must the organization use to manage the accuracy of its measurement equipment?
Calibration and other means of establishing accuracy and repeatability
What is the overall goal of monitoring, measuring, and analysing the key characteristics?
To determine energy performance
What must be true about the energy measurement plan in terms of its execution?
It shall be defined and implemented
What does the organization need to maintain regarding the investigation of significant deviations?
Results of these activities shall be maintained
What two aspects of measurement equipment accuracy must be verified through records?
Accuracy and repeatability
How often must the organization evaluate its compliance with external energy requirements?
At planned intervals, the organization shall evaluate compliance
What two categories of external requirements must the organization evaluate compliance with?
Legal requirements and other requirements to which it subscribes
What specific energy factors must the evaluated requirements be related to?
Its energy use and consumption
What is the consequence if the organization fails to evaluate compliance at planned intervals?
It fails the requirement of Clause 4.6.2
What must be defined for the compliance evaluation process?
The planned intervals at which the evaluation takes place
What must be maintained to demonstrate that compliance evaluation has been performed?
Records of the results of the evaluations of compliance
In addition to compliance with legal requirements, what voluntary obligations must be evaluated?
Compliance with other requirements to which it subscribes
What is the primary requirement for conducting internal audits?
The organization shall conduct internal audits at planned intervals
What must be developed before conducting audits?
An audit plan and schedule shall be developed
Who receives the audit results report?
The audit results shall be reported to top management
What must the audit confirm about the implementation of the EnMS?
That it is effectively implemented and maintained
What must the internal audit verify concerning continual improvement?
That the EnMS improves energy performance
What must the organization address concerning failures and potential failures?
The organization shall address actual and potential nonconformities
Name one action the organization must take when addressing nonconformities.
Reviewing nonconformities or potential nonconformities [65 a)]
What is the term for action taken to eliminate a detected nonconformity?
Correction
What is the term for action taken to eliminate the cause of a detected nonconformity?
Corrective action
What is the term for action taken to eliminate the cause of a potential nonconformity?
Preventive action
What specific type of consequence must the actions be appropriate to?
The energy performance consequences encountered
What three controls must the organization define and implement for records?
Controls for the identification, retrieval and retention of records
What must the records demonstrate concerning energy performance?
The energy performance results achieved
What must be ensured about the identification of records?
Records shall remain identifiable
If a record is difficult to read, which control requirement is violated?
The requirement that records shall remain legible
ask_energy_baseline: What is the fundamental definition of an energy baseline?
An energy baseline is a quantitative reference(s) providing a basis for comparison of energy performance
What is the primary planning output used to establish the energy baseline(s)?
The organization shall establish an energy baseline(s) using the information in the initial energy review
What is the energy baseline used for concerning the results of improvement actions?
The energy baseline is used as a reference before and after implementation of energy performance improvement actions
What must changes in energy performance be measured against, according to the standard?
Changes in energy performance shall be measured against the energy baseline(s)
What is one way an energy baseline can be modified to account for external factors?
An energy baseline can be normalized using variables which affect energy use and/or consumption
Give one specific example of a variable used to normalize an energy baseline that is related to production output.
The baseline can be normalized using variables such as production level
Give one specific example of a variable used to normalize an energy baseline that is related to weather conditions.
The baseline can be normalized using variables such as degree days (outdoor temperature)
What organizational purpose does the maintenance and recording of the energy baseline serve regarding documentation control?
The energy baseline is maintained and recorded as a means for the organization to determine the records maintenance period
What must the organization consider when selecting the data period for establishing the energy baseline?
The organization must consider a data period suitable to the organization's energy use and consumption
What must a suitable data period account for regarding external or seasonal factors?
A suitable data period means the organization accounts for regulatory requirements or variables that affect the energy use and consumption
State the first condition under which adjustments to the energy baseline are required.
Adjustments shall be made if EnPIs no longer reflect organizational energy use and consumption
What operational factor, if changed significantly, requires an adjustment to the energy baseline?
Adjustments shall be made if there have been major changes to the process

ask_general_info: What three concepts are encompassed within the broad term "energy performance"?

The concept of energy performance includes three key aspects: energy use, energy efficiency, and energy consumption . This allows the organization a wide range of activities through which to demonstrate performance improvement
Who determines the pace of continual improvement for the Energy Management System?

The organization determines the rate, extent, and timescale of the continual improvement process . The organization has the flexibility to take into account economic and other considerations when making these determinations
What types of documents or information can serve as examples of "other requirements" to which an organization might subscribe?
Examples of "other requirements" can include agreements with customers, voluntary principles or codes of practice, and participation in voluntary programs
When procuring energy-using products, why is it necessary to assess performance over the expected operating lifetime?

It is necessary to assess energy use, consumption, and efficiency over the planned or expected operating lifetime when procuring energy-using products and equipment that are expected to have a significant impact on the organization's energy performance . This ensures that the procurement process acts as an opportunity to improve energy performance through the use of more efficient products and services
How does the organization ensure that obsolete documents are managed correctly?

The organization must establish, implement, and maintain procedures to prevent the unintended use of obsolete documents . Furthermore, any obsolete documents that must be retained for legal or knowledge preservation purposes must be suitably identified
What should an organization consider when planning its response to contingency or emergency situations regarding energy?

When planning for potential disasters, emergency situations, or contingencies, which includes procuring equipment, an organization may choose to include energy performance in determining how it will react to these situations
What general requirement of the standard confirms that the organization has flexibility in documenting procedures?

The documentation guidance clarifies that only procedures that are explicitly specified as a documented procedure have to be formally documented . The organization maintains the right to develop any documents it deems necessary to effectively demonstrate energy performance and support the EnMS
How does top management fulfill the reporting requirement concerning results measurement?

Top management is responsible for ensuring that results are measured and reported at determined intervals . This involves reviewing and reporting on both the performance of the EnMS and the overall energy performance
What key elements must an organization establish for the effective control of documents?

The organization must establish procedures to approve documents for adequacy prior to issue, periodically review and update them, ensure changes and current revision status are identified, and ensure that relevant versions are available at points of use
What must the organization consider regarding the complexity of its system when defining its energy measurement plan?

The organization must define and implement an energy measurement plan that is appropriate to the size and complexity of the organization and its monitoring and measurement equipment . The necessary measurement means and methods are determined by the organization itself
What must the organization ensure regarding its energy management activities to facilitate effective energy management?
The management representative is responsible for defining and communicating responsibilities and authorities throughout the organization in order to facilitate effective energy management
How should an organization evaluate operations associated with significant energy use to meet policy requirements?

An organization should evaluate those operations associated with its identified significant energy use and ensure they are conducted in a manner that will control or reduce the adverse impacts associated with them . This is essential for fulfilling the requirements of its energy policy and meeting its objectives and targets
How must the management representative promote organizational commitment to energy goals?
The management representative has the responsibility and authority to promote awareness of the energy policy and objectives at all levels of the organization
What must the organization do to ensure that the necessary data is available for the energy review analysis?

The organization must develop, record, and maintain an energy review by analyzing energy use and consumption based on measurement and other data . This analysis must detail the evaluation of past and present energy use and consumption
When is it necessary for the organization to review its Energy Performance Indicators (EnPIs) against the energy baseline?
EnPIs shall be reviewed and compared to the energy baseline as appropriate . This comparison helps ensure that the indicators accurately reflect and measure performance against the reference point
How do the inputs to the management review ensure follow-up and accountability?

The inputs explicitly require the inclusion of follow-up actions from previous management reviews . This ensures that prior decisions and incomplete actions are reviewed for status and accountability in the current review cycle
How must the operational controls be communicated to personnel?
The appropriate communication of the operational controls must be made to personnel working for, or on behalf of, the organization
What specific requirements must the energy policy meet regarding the organization's energy use?
The energy policy must be appropriate to the nature and scale of the organizationâ€™s energy use and consumption
In what media can the Energy Management System documentation be maintained?
The organization shall establish, implement, and maintain the necessary information in paper, electronic, or any other medium
What specific role do records play in documenting conformity?
Records are necessary to demonstrate conformity to the requirements of the organization's EnMS and the International Standard
What happens if the EnPIs no longer reflect organizational energy use and consumption?
If the EnPIs no longer reflect the organizational energy use and consumption, this is one of the conditions that requires adjustments to be made to the energy baseline
Why are the requirements for monitoring, measurement, and analysis critical to the system?

They are critical because they ensure that the key characteristics of the operations that determine energy performance are monitored, measured, and analyzed . This allows for the evaluation of actual versus expected consumption and the effectiveness of action plans
What must the organization consider regarding procurement as an opportunity?

Procurement is considered an opportunity to improve energy performance through the use of more efficient products and services . It is also seen as an opportunity to work with the supply chain and influence its energy behavior
What must the organization do to ensure that external documents necessary for the planning and operation of the EnMS are correctly managed?
The organization must ensure that documents of external origin determined to be necessary for the planning and operation of the EnMS are identified and their distribution controlled
What must be recorded concerning the results of the design activity?

The results of the design activity shall be recorded . This involves incorporating the results of the energy performance evaluation into the relevant project specifications, design, and procurement activities
When determining training needs, what specific areas must the organization focus on?
The organization shall identify training needs specifically associated with the control of its significant energy uses and the operation of its Energy Management System
How is flexibility granted to the organization regarding the review of the management system elements?

The management review should cover the entire scope of the energy management system . However, it is not required that all elements of the energy management system be reviewed at once, and the review process may take place over a period of time
How does the energy management team achieve its objective of delivering improved energy performance?

The energy management team, which can be cross-functional in larger organizations, ensures the delivery of energy performance improvements by supporting the effective implementation of the EnMS activities
When is an organization required to establish criteria for operational and maintenance activities?

Criteria for the effective operation and maintenance of significant energy uses must be established and set in situations where their absence could lead to a significant deviation from effective energy performance
What must the organization ensure regarding its control over external documents?
The organization must ensure that external documents that are deemed necessary for the planning and operation of the EnMS are identified and their distribution is controlled
What action is required when updating documents in the Energy Management System?
Procedures must ensure that documents are periodically reviewed and updated as necessary, and that changes and the current revision status of documents are identified
How does the EnMS help an organization demonstrate conformity?

An EnMS enables an organization to achieve its policy commitments, take necessary action to improve its energy performance, and ultimately demonstrate the conformity of the system to the requirements of this International Standard
What must the organization communicate about the evaluation criteria when procuring products?
When procuring products, the organization must inform suppliers that the procurement is partially evaluated on the basis of energy performance
What must be done to ensure that all relevant versions of applicable documents are accessible?
Procedures must ensure that relevant versions of applicable documents are available at points of use
What information must be included in the EnMS documentation regarding the policy's framework?
The EnMS documentation must include the energy policy, which provides the framework for setting and reviewing energy objectives and targets
What happens to the energy performance assessment results during the design phase?
The energy performance evaluation results must be incorporated, where appropriate, into the specification, design, and procurement activities of the relevant project(s)
What determines the size of the energy management team?
The size of the team is determined by the complexity of the organization, as well as the size and nature of the organization and its available resources
When is the management review required to occur?
The management review is required to occur at planned intervals
What must be recorded concerning the methodology for EnPIs?
The methodology for determining and updating the EnPIs shall be recorded and regularly reviewed
Who is responsible for providing sufficient resources for the EnMS?
Top management is responsible for providing the necessary resources, including financial and technical resources, needed to establish, implement, maintain, and improve the EnMS
What concept is illustrated by the provided Figure A.one?

Figure A.one provides an illustrative conceptual representation of energy performance, showing its relationship with energy use, energy consumption, energy efficiency, energy intensity, and other relevant factors
What must be the focus of the organizationâ€™s review of its activities during the energy planning stage?
Energy planning shall involve a review of the organization's activities that can affect energy performance
What must the organization ensure about its energy objectives and targets concerning the energy review?

When establishing and reviewing objectives and targets, the organization must take into account the significant energy uses and opportunities to improve energy performance identified in the energy review
What must be done with the records of calibration and other means used to establish accuracy?
Records of calibration and other means of establishing the accuracy and repeatability of monitoring and measurement equipment shall be maintained
What must the organization ensure regarding personnelâ€™s understanding of their roles?
The organization must ensure that personnel are aware of their roles, responsibilities, and authorities in achieving the requirements of the Energy Management System
When must the organization make decisions about external communication?
The organization must decide whether to communicate externally about its energy policy, EnMS, and energy performance, and this decision must be documented
How can top management support the importance of energy management through employee involvement?
Top management can support the importance of energy management through employee involvement activities such as empowerment, motivation, recognition, training, and rewards, and participation

The application of this International Standard is intended to be applicable to all types and sizes of organizations, irrespective of geographical, cultural, or social conditions . How are "energy objectives" related to the organization's energy policy?

An energy objective is a specified outcome or achievement that has been set with the purpose of meeting the organization's energy policy in relation to improved energy performance . Who is considered "top management" in relation to the Energy Management System?

Top management is the person or group of people who directs and controls the organization at the highest level . In the context of the EnMS, top management controls the organization that is defined within the system's scope and boundaries

The standard applies to all variables affecting energy performance that can be monitored and influenced by the organization
What specific areas related to energy performance must the requirements of the standard address regarding organizational practices?

The specified requirements are applicable to energy use and consumption, including measurement, documentation and reporting, and also design and procurement practices for equipment, systems, processes, and personnel that contribute to energy performance

This International Standard is applicable to all types and sizes of organizations, irrespective of geographical, cultural or social conditions. An EnMS enables an organization to develop and implement an energy policy, and establish objectives, targets, and action plans which take into account legal requirements and information related to significant energy use

What determines the necessary size of the energy management team?
